verses.kjv: Now these are the nations which the LORD left, to prove Israel by them, even as many of Israel as had not known all the wars of Canaan;
verses.ct: These are the nations the LORD allowed to remain in order to test the Israelites — specifically those who had no experience with the wars in Canaan.

verses.kjv: Only that the generations of the children of Israel might know, to teach them war, at the least such as before knew nothing thereof;
verses.ct: He did this so that future generations of Israelites would learn about warfare, particularly those who had never experienced it before.

verses.kjv: Namely, five lords of the Philistines, and all the Canaanites, and the Sidonians, and the Hivites that dwelt in mount Lebanon, from mount Baalhermon unto the entering in of Hamath.
verses.ct: These nations included the 5 rulers of the Philistines, all the Canaanites, the Sidonians, and the Hivites living in the mountains of Lebanon from Mount Baal-hermon all the way to the entrance of Hamath.

verses.kjv: And they were to prove Israel by them, to know whether they would hearken unto the commandments of the LORD, which he commanded their fathers by the hand of Moses.
verses.ct: These nations served as a test for Israel, to reveal whether the people would listen to the LORD's commands that he had given their ancestors through Moses.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel dwelt among the Canaanites, Hittites, and Amorites, and Perizzites, and Hivites, and Jebusites:
verses.ct: So the Israelites lived alongside the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites.

verses.kjv: And they took their daughters to be their wives, and gave their daughters to their sons, and served their gods.
verses.ct: They married the daughters of these peoples and gave their own daughters to their sons, and they worshiped their gods.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the LORD, and forgat the LORD their God, and served Baalim and the groves.
verses.ct: The Israelites did what was evil in the LORD's sight. They forgot the LORD their God and worshiped the Baals and the Asherah poles.

verses.kjv: Therefore the anger of the LORD was hot against Israel, and he sold them into the hand of Chushanrishathaim king of Mesopotamia: and the children of Israel served Chushanrishathaim eight years.
verses.ct: So the LORD's anger burned against Israel, and he handed them over to Cushan-rishathaim, king of Mesopotamia. The Israelites were subject to Cushan-rishathaim for 8 years.

verses.kjv: And when the children of Israel cried unto the LORD, the LORD raised up a deliverer to the children of Israel, who delivered them, even Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother.
verses.ct: When the Israelites cried out to the LORD, the LORD raised up a rescuer for them — Othniel son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother — and he saved them.

verses.kjv: And the Spirit of the LORD came upon him, and he judged Israel, and went out to war: and the LORD delivered Chushanrishathaim king of Mesopotamia into his hand; and his hand prevailed against Chushanrishathaim.
verses.ct: The Spirit of the LORD came on him, and he led Israel and went out to battle. The LORD gave him victory over Cushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia, and Othniel overpowered him.

verses.kjv: And the land had rest forty years. And Othniel the son of Kenaz died.
verses.ct: Then the land was at peace for 40 years, until Othniel son of Kenaz died.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the LORD: and the LORD strengthened Eglon the king of Moab against Israel, because they had done evil in the sight of the LORD.
verses.ct: Once again the Israelites did what was evil in the LORD's sight. Because of this evil, the LORD gave Eglon king of Moab power over Israel.

verses.kjv: And he gathered unto him the children of Ammon and Amalek, and went and smote Israel, and possessed the city of palm trees.
verses.ct: Eglon joined forces with the Ammonites and the Amalekites, attacked Israel, and captured the City of Palms.

verses.kjv: So the children of Israel served Eglon the king of Moab eighteen years.
verses.ct: The Israelites were subject to Eglon king of Moab for 18 years.

verses.kjv: But when the children of Israel cried unto the LORD, the LORD raised them up a deliverer, Ehud the son of Gera, a Benjamite, a man lefthanded: and by him the children of Israel sent a present unto Eglon the king of Moab.
verses.ct: But when the Israelites cried out to the LORD, he raised up a rescuer for them — Ehud son of Gera, a left-handed man from the tribe of Benjamin. The Israelites sent him to deliver their tribute payment to Eglon king of Moab.

verses.kjv: But Ehud made him a dagger which had two edges, of a cubit length; and he did gird it under his raiment upon his right thigh.
verses.ct: Ehud crafted a double-edged dagger about 18 inches long and strapped it to his right thigh under his clothing.

verses.kjv: And he brought the present unto Eglon king of Moab: and Eglon was a very fat man.
verses.ct: He presented the tribute to Eglon king of Moab, who was an extremely heavy man.

verses.kjv: And when he had made an end to offer the present, he sent away the people that bare the present.
verses.ct: After Ehud finished presenting the tribute, he sent away the men who had carried it.

verses.kjv: But he himself turned again from the quarries that were by Gilgal, and said, I have a secret errand unto thee, O king: who said, Keep silence. And all that stood by him went out from him.
verses.ct: But he himself turned back at the stone quarries near Gilgal and said, "I have a private message for you, king." Eglon replied, "Quiet!" and all his attendants left the room.

verses.kjv: And Ehud came unto him; and he was sitting in a summer parlour, which he had for himself alone. And Ehud said, I have a message from God unto thee. And he arose out of his seat.
verses.ct: Ehud approached him while he sat alone in his cool upper room. Ehud said, "I have a message from God for you." Eglon stood up from his seat.

verses.kjv: And Ehud put forth his left hand, and took the dagger from his right thigh, and thrust it into his belly:
verses.ct: Ehud reached with his left hand, pulled the dagger from his right thigh, and plunged it into Eglon's stomach.

verses.kjv: And the haft also went in after the blade; and the fat closed upon the blade, so that he could not draw the dagger out of his belly; and the dirt came out.
verses.ct: The handle sank in after the blade, and the fat closed around it so that Ehud could not pull the dagger back out. The blade came through his back.

verses.kjv: Then Ehud went forth through the porch, and shut the doors of the parlour upon him, and locked them.
verses.ct: Then Ehud went out through the porch, closing the doors of the upper room behind him and locking them.

verses.kjv: When he was gone out, his servants came; and when they saw that, behold, the doors of the parlour were locked, they said, Surely he covereth his feet in his summer chamber.
verses.ct: After he left, the servants came and found the doors of the upper room locked. They assumed, "He must be relieving himself in the cool chamber."

verses.kjv: And they tarried till they were ashamed: and, behold, he opened not the doors of the parlour; therefore they took a key, and opened them: and, behold, their lord was fallen down dead on the earth.
verses.ct: They waited until they became embarrassed by the delay, but he still didn't open the doors. So they got a key and opened them — and there was their master, collapsed on the floor, dead.

verses.kjv: And Ehud escaped while they tarried, and passed beyond the quarries, and escaped unto Seirath.
verses.ct: While they had been waiting, Ehud escaped. He passed the stone quarries and fled to Seirath.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he was come, that he blew a trumpet in the mountain of Ephraim, and the children of Israel went down with him from the mount, and he before them.
verses.ct: When he arrived, he sounded a trumpet in the hill country of Ephraim, and the Israelites came down from the hills with him, and he took the lead.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Follow after me: for the LORD hath delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand. And they went down after him, and took the fords of Jordan toward Moab, and suffered not a man to pass over.
verses.ct: He told them, "Follow me, because the LORD has given you victory over your enemies the Moabites!" They followed him down, seized the crossing points of the Jordan leading to Moab, and did not allow anyone to cross.

verses.kjv: And they slew of Moab at that time about ten thousand men, all lusty, and all men of valour; and there escaped not a man.
verses.ct: They killed about 10,000 Moabite soldiers that day — all of them strong, capable warriors. Not a single one escaped.

verses.kjv: So Moab was subdued that day under the hand of Israel. And the land had rest fourscore years.
verses.ct: That day Moab was defeated and brought under Israel's control. The land was at peace for 80 years.

verses.kjv: And after him was Shamgar the son of Anath, which slew of the Philistines six hundred men with an ox goad: and he also delivered Israel.
verses.ct: After Ehud came Shamgar son of Anath, who killed 600 Philistines with an ox goad. He too rescued Israel.
